subject: Add functional recreate test for bug 1852610
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-15 14:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_services.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/28d76cc7ae5c86d251915392b5b961a975b343ae', 'message': 'Add functional recreate test for bug 1852610

It is possible to delete a source compute service which has
pending migration-based allocations and servers in VERIFY_RESIZE
status. Doing so deletes the compute service and compute node
but orphans the source node resource provider along with its
resource allocations held by the migration record while there
is a pending resized server.

This adds a simple cold migrate test which deletes the source
compute service while the server is in VERIFY_RESIZE status and
then tries to confirm the resize which fails.

Change-Id: I644608b4e197ddea31c5f264adb492f2c8931f04
Related-Bug: #1852610
(cherry picked from commit 94d3743b185d22c07504f5d878dff2f9ef42cee3)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional recreate test for bug 1852610

It is possible to delete a source compute service which has
pending migration-based allocations and servers in VERIFY_RESIZE
status. Doing so deletes the compute service and compute node
but orphans the source node resource provider along with its
resource allocations held by the migration record while there
is a pending resized server.

This adds a simple cold migrate test which deletes the source
compute service while the server is in VERIFY_RESIZE status and
then tries to confirm the resize which fails.

Change-Id: I644608b4e197ddea31c5f264adb492f2c8931f04
Related-Bug: #1852610
(cherry picked from commit 94d3743b185d22c07504f5d878dff2f9ef42cee3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/694544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_migrate_confirm_after_deleted_source_compute(self): """Tests a scenario where a server is cold migrated and while in VERIFY_RESIZE status the admin attempts to delete the source compute and then the user tries to confirm the resize. """ # Start a compute service and create a server there. self._start_compute('host1') host1_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host('host1') flavor = self.api.get_flavors()[0] server = self._boot_and_check_allocations(flavor, 'host1') # Start a second compute service so we can cold migrate there. self._start_compute('host2') host2_rp_uuid = self._get_provider_uuid_by_host('host2') # Cold migrate the server to host2. self._migrate_and_check_allocations( server, flavor, host1_rp_uuid, host2_rp_uuid) # Delete the source compute service. service = self.admin_api.get_services( binary='nova-compute', host='host1')[0] self.admin_api.api_delete('/os-services/%s' % service['id']) # FIXME(mriedem): This is bug 1852610 where the compute service is # deleted but the resource provider is not because there are still # migration-based allocations against the source node provider. resp = self.placement_api.get('/resource_providers/%s' % host1_rp_uuid) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertFlavorMatchesUsage(host1_rp_uuid, flavor) # Now try to confirm the migration. # FIXME(mriedem): This will fail until bug 1852610 is fixed and the # source compute service delete is blocked while there is an # in-progress migration involving the node. self.assertNotIn('ComputeHostNotFound', self.stdlog.logger.output) self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], {'confirmResize': None}) self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ERROR') self.assertIn('ComputeHostNotFound', self.stdlog.logger.output)

subject: Elaborate on Extended Maintenance to EOL transition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-09-16 14:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/stable-branches.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide/commit/6f12005bb8b1169c14f72a14b1bc4c8fdce4885a', 'message': 'Elaborate on Extended Maintenance to EOL transition

This adds a little more wording around end of life for stable branches
to make sure it's clear that a team can decide to go directly from EM to
EOL without needing to wait 6 months for an "Unmaintained" phase to
complete.

Also fixes some minor nits while I'm here.

Change-Id: I92542012108f0aa07e28968479cdaddf7e06301d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Elaborate on Extended Maintenance to EOL transition

This adds a little more wording around end of life for stable branches
to make sure it's clear that a team can decide to go directly from EM to
EOL without needing to wait 6 months for an "Unmaintained" phase to
complete.

Also fixes some minor nits while I'm here.

Change-Id: I92542012108f0aa07e28968479cdaddf7e06301d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/81/682381/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================ * 0 - 6 months maintainers. * Branch no longer accepting changes.After a project/branch exceeds the time allocation as `Unmaintained`, or a team decides to explicitly end support for a branch, it will become End of Life. The HEAD of the appropriate branch will be tagged
deleted_lines: ================================== * 6 months maintainers * Branch no longer accepting changesAfter a project/branch exceeds the time allocation as `Unmaintained`_, it will be become End of Life. The HEAD of the appropriate branch will be tagged

commit_message:
k8s_fedora_atomic: Add PodSecurityPolicy

For moving to 1.15.x and beyond we need to have PSP for privileged pods.
flannel, calico and node-problem-detector need it.

PSP
story: 2006515
task: 36513

Allow-priv
story: 2006252
task: 35867

Change-Id: I306a249afb275fdbd71354ed75043ffc4d466304
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit 7267c1ea43b72849ece0bedb0a18bfc438829354)

commit_message:
Remove (most) '/os-networks' REST APIs

Drop support for most of the 'os-networks' REST APIs excluding those
that proxy through to neutron.

This API now returns a 410 response for the non-proxy routes.

Unit tests are removed for removed APIs and the functional API sample
tests are just asserting the 410 response now same. The latter are also
expanded to cover APIs that weren't previously tested.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference still builds
from those and can be considered more or less branchless, so people
looking at the API reference can apply it to older deployments of nova
before these APIs were removed.

Note: yes, the API samples are correct. It really is a useless API when
used with neutron.

Change-Id: I68bfa77a520382317fc490a4f6c12dd62fc6dcda
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove 'os-security-group-default-rules' REST API

This is a nova-network-only API. As with previously removed APIs, this
API now return a 410 response for all routes.

There are some DB methods that were only used by this API. They will be
removed separately in a future change.

Change-Id: Iaa7fb6c548613164d33793822ee85339f9f7fefb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove unused '*_default_rules' security group DB APIs

With the API removed, nothing is using these anymore. Remove them.

Change-Id: Id303edc0e3b4af5647ce171b7763e094d1aa244c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[DNM] Example introducing f-strings

Do not merge! This is a demo change.

Try using f-strings. It should fail in patchset 1, but pass if we
explicitly bump pyflakes in patchset 2.

commit_message:
Allow region setting for ironic-neutron-agent

The "os_region" param is missing in the ironic_neutron_agent.ini.j2
file. Without specifying the region, the neutron service will randomly
pick a region for the ironic-neutron-agent. Therefore, a list of
incorrect agents might be created in the neutron database "agents"
table for nodes from other regions. To list all neutron agents, use
'openstack network agent list'.

Change-Id: Idec265230d0ab63b7559d94690c059608dc2617e
Closes-bug: #1853464
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/93/695093/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not remove rhos-release if running leapp unsubscribed.

The option leapp_unsubscribed allows us to run the Leapp
upgrade without need of a subscription (relies on external
workarounds and hacks). As it uses rhos-release underneath
to provide with the RHEL8 repos, we can't get rid of rhos-
release as we were doing when the node was subscribed.

Change-Id: I08abf241ee742622593e5c841db127fcf78c3d13

commit_message:
Replace git.openstack.org with opendev.org

Also update the location of the openstackclient cookbook and make it
possible to test patches there as dependencies, too.

Change-Id: I19894b6f71d2a9aaf2ad0b7d93728fee862eb93c

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Networking Generic Switch is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I254c94e32b03f80ea3589498e7f71fbc64204a58

subject: nova-net: Add TODOs for remaining nova-network functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-09-24 13:53:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/abedbcab095e65f2ae382974f2861ca3ce4260a6', 'message': "nova-net: Add TODOs for remaining nova-network functional tests

These are for the few tests that can't be converted since they're for
nova-network. The following APIs have no neutron equivalent and
therefore can't be converted:

- POST /os-security-group-default-rules
    Raises 'HTTPNotImplemented' from the neutron security group driver
- GET /os-security-group-default-rules
    Raises 'HTTPNotImplemented' from the neutron security group driver
- GET /os-security-group-default-rules/{id}
    Raises 'HTTPNotImplemented' from the neutron security group driver
- POST /os-tenant-networks
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- DELETE /os-tenant-networks/{id}
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- POST /os-networks
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- POST /os-networks/add
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- DELETE /os-networks/{id}
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver

The following work but need to be converted separately. We'll do that
later when we remove the nova-network side of the APIs.

- GET /os-networks
- GET /os-networks/{id}
- GET /os-tenant-networks

Explicit 'USE_NEUTRON = True' entries are removed since they're no
longer necessary. A TODO is removed since it's no longer really
applicable (most that can be fixed have been).

Change-Id: Ide357a4e1479cacc8fcee80893dfbffb65ce8712
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
nova-net: Add TODOs for remaining nova-network functional tests

These are for the few tests that can't be converted since they're for
nova-network. The following APIs have no neutron equivalent and
therefore can't be converted:

- POST /os-security-group-default-rules
    Raises 'HTTPNotImplemented' from the neutron security group driver
- GET /os-security-group-default-rules
    Raises 'HTTPNotImplemented' from the neutron security group driver
- GET /os-security-group-default-rules/{id}
    Raises 'HTTPNotImplemented' from the neutron security group driver
- POST /os-tenant-networks
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- DELETE /os-tenant-networks/{id}
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- POST /os-networks
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- POST /os-networks/add
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- POST /os-networks/{id}/action
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver
- DELETE /os-networks/{id}
    Raises 'NotImplemented' from the neutron network driver

The following work but need to be converted separately. We'll do that
later when we remove the nova-network side of the APIs.

- GET /os-networks
- GET /os-networks/{id}
- GET /os-tenant-networks

Change-Id: Ide357a4e1479cacc8fcee80893dfbffb65ce8712
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here. For information please refer [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/

Change-Id: I186bb5edfaece73222534fbede928f0903595b04

deleted_lines: envlist = py37,pep8,docs[testenv:py3-dj111] basepython = python3 commands = pip install django>=1.11,<2 {[testenv]commands}

commit_message:
Fix if condition to test for var==true

Change the validation of the script execution to run only when
CERT_MANAGER_API == true as per default definition. 

dropping:  if RUN != "false"

Change-Id: I73aad3a3455fa3ebf9b360c40aa6ac003a44ac8a

commit_message:
Adding missing tag for dynamic-address-fact task

Certain playbooks require dynamic facts at runtime and when
using tags like project-config, these tasks need to be called,
otherwise the template evaluation stops trying to resolve the facts.

Change-Id: I40e55671aed8df741e27ce8b2581b293a344afc0
(cherry picked from commit 096691d2ebfedfe5d66fd60f6a674bb69ae5e533)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/05/695305/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Verify the sanitize keys are lowered

This change is preventative to ensure any keys added in the future are
all lowercase.

Change-Id: Ib843fe59a80b081d9d0193717ff5a980e22c81b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/85/695385/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _LOWER_SANITIZE_KEYS = [k.lower() for k in _SANITIZE_KEYS] # specified in _LOWER_SANITIZE_KEYS, if not then just return the message # since we don't have to mask any passwords. for key in _LOWER_SANITIZE_KEYS: if key in message.lower(): for sani_key in _LOWER_SANITIZE_KEYS: if sani_key in k.lower():
deleted_lines: # specified in _SANITIZE_KEYS, if not then just return the message since # we don't have to mask any passwords. for key in _SANITIZE_KEYS: if key.lower() in message.lower(): for sani_key in _SANITIZE_KEYS: if sani_key.lower() in k.lower():

The report client _ensure_resource_provider() call gathers RPs
associated to the compute RP via aggregates but only those that has the

Change-Id: I3eaff83c9ea2e71843a73fb1d00e3b802c573e36
'}]
commit_message:
Specify what RPs _ensure_resource_provider collects

The report client _ensure_resource_provider() call gathers RPs
associated to the compute RP via aggregates but only those that has the
MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE trait, i.e. only the sharing RPs.

Change-Id: I3eaff83c9ea2e71843a73fb1d00e3b802c573e36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/695429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - All sharing providers associated via aggregate with all providers in said tree
deleted_lines: - All providers associated via aggregate with all providers in said tree

commit_message:
Make sure we apply all deploy step-0 during update.

That step include, in particular, the puppet-container.py/sh creation
file plus some other task that should happen very early during the
deploy process.

During update if a change in puppet-container.py happen in the
template we have to trigger those steps to get the changes.  This is
especially critical because we run puppet container configuration
during the update stage.

Closes-Bug: #1853156
Change-Id: I26406da82c584dc5093c17ad26f263057a5cbcaa

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

ironic-inspector is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: Ifae00adf782b6a7d71c4dc45a69a9638b8514d30

commit_message:
Fix conditionals in CI playbook

These were not templated, so always evaluated to true. This shouldn't be
causing any issues.

Change-Id: I7b8e407e688ba201c4f7d1a94bbd41af0918e7df

subject: Fix IPA execution issues due to lack of entropy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-19 20:52:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder/commit/09f9b550fdbc852640196f66f3e16efa9b4cb586', 'message': 'Fix IPA execution issues due to lack of entropy

While running TinyIPA stable/stein images in KVM virtual machines with
Tenks, we noticed that IPA would start but not execute further, which
appeared to be caused by a lack of entropy.

This patch installs haveged, a simple entropy daemon [1], into the
tinyipa ramdisk and starts it on boot, which resolves the issue.

While this problem was reproduced reliably with stable/stein and not
seen with stable/train or stable/rocky images, we will start running
haveged in all versions, for consistency. It adds less than 20 KiB to
the ramdisk.

[1] http://www.issihosts.com/haveged/

Change-Id: I7d47b7828733cc03c1ed6c370c451465a6d492b6
Story: 2006911
Task: 37554

commit_message:
Fix IPA execution issues due to lack of entropy

While running TinyIPA stable/stein images in KVM virtual machines with
Tenks, we noticed that IPA would start but not execute further, which
appeared to be caused by a lack of entropy.

This patch installs haveged, a simple entropy daemon [1], into the
tinyipa ramdisk and starts it on boot, which resolves the issue.

While this problem was reproduced reliably with stable/stein and not
seen with stable/train or stable/rocky images, we will start running
haveged in all versions, for consistency. It adds less than 20 KiB to
the ramdisk.

[1] http://www.issihosts.com/haveged/

Change-Id: I7d47b7828733cc03c1ed6c370c451465a6d492b6
Story: 2006911
Task: 37554
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder refs/changes/80/695080/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: ovn standalone: Start OVN ovsdb-servers using the kolla startup script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-22 15:21:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/bdc9164d20955557588a3d4cb4cee12020792cec', 'message': "ovn standalone: Start OVN ovsdb-servers using the ovn-ctl script

Prior to this patch, ovsdb-servers are started directly. This doesn't
take care of any ovsdb schema updates. Instead, if we start using
the ovn-ctl script, it takes care of creating the db file from
the schema file if the db file doesn't exist. It also takes
care of updating the db file if schema was updated.

This patch also prepares the ground for using the latest OVN.
OVN is split from openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After
the split, OVN has its own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/),
log dir (/var/logs/ovn) and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated and it is transparent.

Change-Id: I1fbfaf43af17b558497fd2b46fc4278b4703ec74
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-10-23 07:06:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/8cddc6bc2ee5dcaf3eee4e2ddb0b1038d35270d2', 'message': "[WIP]: ovn standalone: Start OVN ovsdb-servers using the ovn-ctl script

Prior to this patch, ovsdb-servers are started directly. This doesn't
take care of any ovsdb schema updates. Instead, if we use the
start-nb/sb-db-server.sh (generated by kolla OVN images [1])
it takes care of creating the db file from the schema file if the db
file doesn't exist. It also takes care of updating the db file if schema was updated.
The start-nb/sb-db-server.sh used ovn-ctl script internally.

This patch also prepares the ground for using the latest OVN.
OVN is split from openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After
the split, OVN has its own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/),
log dir (/var/logs/ovn) and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated and it is transparent.

Prior to this patch, ovsdb-servers are started directly. This doesn't
take care of any ovsdb schema updates. Instead, if we use the
start-nb/sb-db-server.sh (generated by kolla OVN images [1])
it takes care of creating the db file from the schema file if the db
file doesn't exist. It also takes care of updating the db file if schema was updated.
The start-nb/sb-db-server.sh used ovn-ctl script internally.

This patch also prepares the ground for using the latest OVN.
OVN is split from openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After
the split, OVN has its own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/),
log dir (/var/logs/ovn) and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated and it is transparent.

[1] in kolla has broken the tripleo ovn standalone jobs. This patch will

commit_message:
ovn standalone: Start OVN ovsdb-servers using the kolla startup script

Prior to this patch, ovsdb-servers are started directly. This doesn't
take care of any ovsdb schema updates. Instead, if we use the
start-nb/sb-db-server.sh (generated by kolla OVN images [1])
it takes care of creating the db file from the schema file if the db
file doesn't exist. It also takes care of updating the db file if schema was updated.
The start-nb/sb-db-server.sh used ovn-ctl script internally.

This patch also prepares the ground for using the latest OVN.
OVN is split from openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After
the split, OVN has its own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/),
log dir (/var/logs/ovn) and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated and it is transparent.

Closes-bug: #1853272
Change-Id: I1fbfaf43af17b558497fd2b46fc4278b4703ec74
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>

commit_message:
NetcatTester.stop_processes skip "No such process" exception

If any of the processes, client or server, spawned by NetcatTester is
not present during the stop command (kill signal sent), by default the
method will not raise an exception.

Change-Id: If8cf47a01dc353734ad07ca6cd4db7bec6c90fb6
Closes-Bug: #1852869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/695047/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import exceptions as n_exc def stop_processes(self, skip_errors=None): skip_errors = ['No such process'] if skip_errors is None else skip_errors try: if proc.poll() is None: proc.kill() proc.wait() except n_exc.ProcessExecutionError as exc: for skip_error in skip_errors: if skip_error in str(exc): break else: raise exc
deleted_lines: def stop_processes(self): if proc.poll() is None: proc.kill() proc.wait()

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Id4ba8fdf54276ce53601337b3006728724831084

commit_message:
Support TimeoutStartSec for etcd and heat agent systemd services

Now Magnum is using podman and systemd to manage the etcd service
and start heat-container-agent. In cases where the nodes pull images
from docker.io or another mirror registry with high latency, the etcd
or heat container agent service take long time to start, which is
causing timeout when bootstraping k8s cluster for fedora atomic/coreos
drivers. This patch fixes it by adding TimeoutStartSec for the systemd
services.

Task: 37452
Story: 2006459

Change-Id: I89855983f45544f202fc94ede396d1b0c44d286e
(cherry picked from commit 735fadf53c6a2334be87b47be172d311768c5941)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/39/695639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate keystone::endpoint and keystone::roles::admin

This patch deprecates the keystone::endpoint and
keystone::roles::admin classes in favor of the
same functionality provided in the keystone::bootstrap
class.

This is another of the steps required to move to a unified
bootstrapping of keystone using the keystone-manage bootstrap
command and removing the admin_token usage.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692665
Change-Id: I1fbf1e3e367b1a1f638a812844ec60d83fed4822

commit_message:
Documentation for nested-dpdk case

This commit contains spec file for nested-dpdk
case in kuryr-kubernetes. It describes how to setup
and use it.

Implements: blueprint nested-dpdk-support
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate admin_token, admin_password and enable_bootstrap

This patch deprecates and removes the functionality of the
admin_token, admin_password and enable_boostrap parameters
in the keystone class in favor of the new keystone::bootstrap
class.

Deployments must now define this class in order to bootstrap
keystone with the proper credentials that can then be used
later.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692665/
Change-Id: I8969ac647d679de46a09ec294d737d1bff433a1f

commit_message:
Splits STIG yum add/removes

In order to prevent RPM database corruption on the target hosts, this
change splits the STIG yum add/remove tasks into two separate plays.

Change-Id: I68751339d5b4cbfb61b8e3cf4ffbfeb47ea5fd76
Closes-Bug: #1851954
(cherry picked from commit 8db1a33cbf636865fd876f2e312972c0f1d28c04)

commit_message:
Increase cpu limit for image conversion

The 8 second timeout is not always sufficient for
large images.

Bump to 30s, which matches what Nova currently
uses for this same limit.

Change-Id: I0c26c400f08d91c8c125c69e06e4c90302bcdbb1
Closes-Bug: #1705340

commit_message:
Update bindep.txt for some missing dependencies

We rely on curl for a few things that like to download remote files.

The failure cleanup processes rely on "ps" to kill left-over chroot
processes (_get_chroot_processes)

git is required for source installs

Change-Id: Icddcc13d568b8d5cd3e8de05907ff327136088df

commit_message:
Support TimeoutStartSec for etcd and heat agent systemd services

Now Magnum is using podman and systemd to manage the etcd service
and start heat-container-agent. In cases where the nodes pull images
from docker.io or another mirror registry with high latency, the etcd
or heat container agent service take long time to start, which is
causing timeout when bootstraping k8s cluster for fedora atomic/coreos
drivers. This patch fixes it by adding TimeoutStartSec for the systemd
services.

Task: 37452
Story: 2006459

Change-Id: I89855983f45544f202fc94ede396d1b0c44d286e

commit_message:
Fix cert_manager_api with x509keypair

When magnum is using x509keypair as backend
the db query fails to apply the tenant filters
due to the missing context.

Pass the context to the the cert_manager.

story: 2006897
task: 37533

Change-Id: Ifdedac420fe4384013704865fa05ea6f1c15feb5
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Do a retry on rpc after MessageDeliveryFailure

Sometime after restarting the rabbitmq rpc fails
and only restart of the mistral services fixes it.
This is a workaround that does one retry and a recreation
of the client after a delivery failure.

This is a temporary work around until we find a better
solution

Change-Id: If888589613e994cc879f49da3507254320625aae

commit_message:
Remove references to writable LDAP from documentation

Keystone removed support for writable LDAP backends in Ocata. Prior to
that it was deprecated for several releases. This commit removes
references to those configuration options since they are silently
ignored. This cleans up the configuration files and doesn't give the
impression that functionality is still supported.

Relevant release notes that advertize the removal:

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/ocata.html#relnotes-11-0-0-origin-stable-ocata-other-notes

Change-Id: Id05247d004ee7d189dff3ec867a6ec11dfc40e9b
(cherry picked from commit 83dc547d675b550de13278dce66961c7d45759c6)

commit_message:
ZVM: Implement update_provider_tree

This patch implements update_provider_tree() in the ZVMDriver

As in Train [1] nova deprecated support for compute drivers
that did not implement the update_provider_tree method.
And the compat code is now removed in [2].

[1] I1eae47bce08f6292d38e893a2122289bcd6f4b58
[2] Ib62ac0b692eb92a2ed364ec9f486ded05def39ad

Change-Id: I76192a4c8adb192b12c0ceb71bf5f5a318018b87

commit_message:
Periodic jobs are failing for python 3.5

Periodic tips jobs are failing because python 3.5 interpreter
is not available on testing nodes. It is decided that Stein
branch should be tested with python 3.6 version.

Renamed periodic tips jobs to 3.6 and added python 3.6 enviornment
in tox.ini to run periodic tips jobs against python 3.6
environment.

Change-Id: I8a763eff7c6524969b1fabf98ab0a5624954d8b3
Closes-Bug: #1822238
(cherry picked from commit 79e4adaf436a1e231db68361a85c5ca903ccda61)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Watcher is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/

Change-Id: I603c6d2c22779e8ef2e70eb6369fc521a77c9c3a

commit_message:
Add output for mis-configured element scripts

I commonly get asked for help when people are attempting to create
local image elements and they cannot get them to work.
diskimage-builder silently ignores element scripts that it doesn't
find to it's liking, such as non-executable or files with extensions
(.sh is a common mistake).
This patch extends the '-x' tracing flag down to dib-run-parts and
will cause it to print out helpful messages when these files would
otherwise be silently ignored.

Examples:
Ignoring non-executable files: 10-do-not-run-me
Ignoring non-conforming filenames: 10-I-can-run.sh

I am not enabling these by default as they can create extra noise
and require additional filesystem IO to produce.

Change-Id: Ic804efca3015c199440b4b10da951d71a815c64f

commit_message:
Only wait for checksum processes

When running under nodepool in a foreground, non-daemonized situation
without a tty (i.e. within a container) we're seeing this "wait" hang
indefinitely.

It is probably related to "outfilter.py" and output file descriptors,
although TBH we haven't completely root-caused it.  I won't claim this
is a great solution, but it should hopefully let the dib process
finish and just die, where outfilter will disappear.

Change-Id: If78da54df3d4c240fee16aee4413ec554b37c1d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/38/695338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(pabelanger): Read image into memory once and generate # both checksum files. # NOTE(ianw): we've seen issues with this waiting for # our outfilter.py wrapper when containerised (probably due to # no tty). Waiting for just these processes is a bit of hacky # workaround ... declare -a wait_for md5sum $1 > $1.md5 & wait_for+=($!) sha256sum $1 > $1.sha256 & wait_for+=$($!) wait "${wait_for[@]}"
deleted_lines: # NOTE(pabelanger): Read image into memory once and generate both checksum # files. md5sum $1 > $1.md5 & sha256sum $1 > $1.sha256 & wait

commit_message:
Ensure nouveau is blacklisted in initramfs too

To ensure dracut does not load nouveau we need to explicitly disable it via
omit_drivers.
This change adds a method to drop in arbitary dracut conf files to an element
which are picked up by dracut-regenerate and included in the chroot where we
run dracut.

The disable-nouveau element just adds a conf file with
`omit_drivers += " nouveau"`
The default dracut conf files in /usr/lib include a similar file to omit the
nvidia kernel modules.

Change-Id: I6375e4843fd08d1410141fbbd8658042dcd5ad05
Closes-bug: 1842664
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/92/679992/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Also adds the ability to copy specific files into /etc/dracut.d directory, to allow any dracut settings to be configured. To achieve that the files to be copied need to be placed inside an specific dracut.d directory of the element.

commit_message:
Adds support for GPG keyring

Currently DIB_ADD_APT_KEYS only supports GPG armor keys, while
default Debuntu apt gpg keys are in keyring format.

Change-Id: I361c375e25b03a08b19052b10c6733939c8df921
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/26/693426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! file -b "${KEY}" | grep -qE '(PGP public key block|GPG key public ring)'; then
deleted_lines: if ! file -b "${KEY}" | grep -q 'PGP public key block'; then

subject: Introduce manual setting of DIB_INIT_SYSTEM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 14:43:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/1f8a43838bad05c94f0a683ad20f1509e2488543', 'message': 'Move evaluation of init system to chroot phases

The previous implementation evaluates the dib-init-system too early:
first time it is evaluated on the host (which should not be).
Later on it is evaluated during the `environment.d` phase. At this
phase the init system of the generated VM might even not be installed
(as e.g. for Debian Stretch).

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-13 18:09:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/14b2a5c0ac2b1f0b610962b0a0f90a1bee8485c3', 'message': 'Move evaluation of init system to chroot phases

The previous implementation evaluates the dib-init-system too early:
first time it is evaluated on the host (which should not be).
Later on it is evaluated during the `environment.d` phase. At this
phase the init system of the generated VM might even not be installed
(as e.g. for Debian Stretch).

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-02 18:39:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/1a5f312f3005d5bbfae6199a22af6a4b5c8fa788', 'message': 'Introduce manual setting of DIB_INIT_SYSTEM

The current implementation evauates the dib-init-system
script too early.  Also it looks that there is no simple
way of getting the info about the init system automatically:
another element can install (later on) a different
init system.  Therefore the only reliable way of setting
this is manual.

commit_message:
Introduce manual setting of DIB_INIT_SYSTEM

The current implementation evauates the dib-init-system
script too early.  Also it looks that there is no simple
way of getting the info about the init system automatically:
another element can install (later on) a different
init system.  Therefore the only reliable way of setting
this is manual.

Change-Id: I6e9ffa1bdb3154f488f4fd335b197699b86aacd4
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/79/414179/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: use on the target image.Do not cache the result during the environment.d setup - this will run the check on the host. The script has to be called each time the result is needed and it must be only used in phases which run in chroot (like pre-install.d, install.d or post-install.d).
deleted_lines: use on the target image. Also sets an environment variable ``DIB_INIT_SYSTEM`` to this value.Environment Variables --------------------- DIB_INIT_SYSTEM :Description: One of upstart, systemd, or sysv depending on the init system in use for the target image.

commit_message:
Don't delete compute node, when deleting service other than nova-compute

We should not try to delete compute node from compute_nodes table,
when destroying service other than nova-compute.

Change-Id: If5b5945e699ec2e2da51d5fa90616431274849b0
Closes-Bug: #1852993
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
(cherry picked from commit cff9ecb20870daa56b1cfd6fbb9f5817d1306fda)
(cherry picked from commit 716cde5454a5cd527040c60dbfd2b6ed37a1975c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/695381/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if service.binary == 'nova-compute': # TODO(sbauza): Remove the service_id filter in a later release # once we are sure that all compute nodes report the host field model_query(context, models.ComputeNode).\ filter(or_(models.ComputeNode.service_id == service_id, models.ComputeNode.host == service['host'])).\ soft_delete(synchronize_session=False)
deleted_lines: # TODO(sbauza): Remove the service_id filter in a later release # once we are sure that all compute nodes report the host field model_query(context, models.ComputeNode).\ filter(or_(models.ComputeNode.service_id == service_id, models.ComputeNode.host == service['host'])).\ soft_delete(synchronize_session=False)

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2019-11-20 21:35:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/316347d5d3eca46aabe02045fe92ae546d387248', 'message': "Prometheus: Update chart to support federation

This updates the Prometheus chart to support federation. This
moves to defining the Prometheus configuration file via a template
in the values.yaml file instead of through raw yaml. This allows
for overriding the chart's default configuration wholesale, as
this would be required for a hierarchical federated setup. This

commit_message:
Prometheus: Update chart to support federation

This updates the Prometheus chart to support federation. This
moves to defining the Prometheus configuration file via a template
in the values.yaml file instead of through raw yaml. This allows
for overriding the chart's default configuration wholesale, as
this would be required for a hierarchical federated setup. This
also strips out all of the default rules defined in the chart for
the same reason. There are example rules defined for the various
aspects of OSH's infrastructure in the prometheus/values_overrides
directory that are executed as part of the normal CI jobs. This
also adds a nonvoting federated-monitoring job that vets out the
ability to federate prometheus in a hierarchical fashion with
extremely basic overrides

Change-Id: I0f121ad5e4f80be4c790dc869955c6b299ca9f26
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Networking Baremetal is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I7f08a871ba82081f6164f84f05f50eb61cfd7541

commit_message:
This add chunk_size related parameters for proxy-server and object-server.

New parameters for proxy class are object_chunk_size and client_chunk_size,
and for storage class: network_chunk_size, disk_chunk_size and
auditor_disk_chunk_size.

Change-Id: If2bbc9cea1f6e0959fd67d2e004b607a8e40beee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/35/695035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*network_chunk_size*] # (optional) Size of chunks to read/write over the network. # Defaults to 65536. # # [*disk_chunk_size*] # (optional) Size of chunks to read/write to disk. # Defaults to 65536. # # [*auditor_disk_chunk_size*] # (optional) Object-auditor size of chunks to read/write to disk. # Defaults to undef. # $network_chunk_size = 65536, $disk_chunk_size = 65536, $auditor_disk_chunk_size = undef,

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-19 18:17:25.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/e5dad445b258b6fd823bddb7b1e3ca10064ba3e8', 'message': 'Switch py2 DSVM jobs to only run swift under py2

Other services are fine to move on to py3. We still want to test py2,

commit_message:
Switch py2 DSVM jobs to only run swift under py2

Other services are fine to move on to py3. We still want to test py2,
though.

Change-Id: I488f88a54948663c682b35dc976b62db6e72eef7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/57/695057/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Other services are fine to run py3 USE_PYTHON3: true # explicitly state that we want to test swift under py2 DISABLED_PYTHON3_PACKAGES: 'swift'

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-21 12:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/config-sriov.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6b524de73aa1738ca888b10a5e1411b307a3a485', 'message': 'doc: add known limitation about attaching SR-IOV ports

Change-Id: I0a954de724384a81cb45446da20fa6b17d4bd63a
Related-Bug: #1708433
(cherry picked from commit 60a9248b17cad8d2e7dd49cea120348dda99dc2b)

commit_message:
doc: add known limitation about attaching SR-IOV ports

Nova does not currently support attaching SR-IOV ports to
existing instances, you can only create a server with an
SR-IOV port at this time. This adds an item about that
limitation to the SR-IOV admin docs.

Change-Id: I0a954de724384a81cb45446da20fa6b17d4bd63a
Related-Bug: #1708433
(cherry picked from commit 60a9248b17cad8d2e7dd49cea120348dda99dc2b)
(cherry picked from commit 7859941647077a567fc1d546652dc738273328f0)
(cherry picked from commit 354709f63ac8f83eadfce60d6fea58aa071900c2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/695409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Attaching SR-IOV ports to existing servers is not currently supported, see `bug 1708433 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1708433>`_ for details.

commit_message:
Re-enable experimental jobs in osh-infra

This adds the experimental jobs back to osh-infra, as they were
erroneously disabled via comments in a previously merged change

Change-Id: Id92c24223f8c22f1a0ff82b62c222b2920ecd929
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Update egress HTK method

This patch set places logic to generate kubernetes egress network policy
rule based on the dependencies specified in values.yaml. This also sets
up the necessary default network policy for the OSH gate.

Change-Id: I1ac649cc9debb5d1f4ea0a32f506dcda4d8b8536
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Escape invalid JSON characters during deployment.

By first quoting the JSON query, it is possible to easily pass
it to the json_query plugin. This allows elements with special
characters, such as a hyphen -, to be resolvable.

Change-Id: I56f3e5f96dc25f16aed585ca6678de53721071b7
Closes-Bug: #1853321
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/10/693910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Quote the JSON queries to escape invalid characters set_fact: item_id: '"{{ item }}".id' item_group: '"{{ item }}".group' item_only: '"{{ item }}"' deployment_uuid: "{{ lookup('file', tripleo_role_name ~ '/' ~ ansible_hostname | lower ~ '/' ~ item) | from_yaml | json_query(item_id) }}" deployment_group: "{{ lookup('file', tripleo_role_name ~ '/' ~ ansible_hostname | lower ~ '/' ~ item) | from_yaml | json_query(item_group') }}" content: "[ {{ deployment_content.content | b64decode | from_yaml | json_query(item_only) }} ]" content: "[ {{ deployment_content.content | b64decode | from_yaml | json_query(item_only) }} ]"
deleted_lines: deployment_uuid: "{{ lookup('file', tripleo_role_name ~ '/' ~ ansible_hostname | lower ~ '/' ~ item) | from_yaml | json_query(item ~ '.id') }}" deployment_group: "{{ lookup('file', tripleo_role_name ~ '/' ~ ansible_hostname | lower ~ '/' ~ item) | from_yaml | json_query(item ~ '.group') }}" content: "[ {{ deployment_content.content | b64decode | from_yaml | json_query(item) }} ]" content: "[ {{ deployment_content.content | b64decode | from_yaml | json_query(item) }} ]"

commit_message:
Add groups.yaml containing Validation Groups definition

This file will be the source of reference for all the groups used by
tripleo-Validations. It will be deployed next to the playbooks/roles[1]
in order to parsed by the TripleO Validator CLI and its new
subcommand[2].

It will also be the reference for the tripleo-validations documentation
and will be automated in a follow up patch.

[1] - /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-validations/groups.yaml
[2] - openstack tripleo validator group list

Change-Id: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
(cherry picked from commit 6df86cdffe3d92b493926140076686c6352c432c)
(cherry picked from commit f43f1cf9f753b4b8d911e6ca61e8cc7cdab5a0e2)

subject: Call Glance list with certain image ids
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-21 17:46:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/da0925bd0dbda94db74ac72f8430400458936a5e', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

Achieve this by preparing a dictionary of images to be later used by
api.nova.Server - and prepare them prior to wrapping entities fetched
with novaclient with api.nova.Server. Thus the number of calls to
Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the image entity
within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9

Achieve this by preparing a cache for images to be later used by
api.nova.Server - and prepare them prior to wrapping entities fetched
with novaclient with api.nova.Server. Thus the number of calls to
Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the image entity
within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Sutyagin <dsutyagin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Karikh <pkarikh@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9
'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2015-10-30 11:35:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/34d3985403041e02be5ecdfb020ebe9e180de4eb', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

Achieve this by caching for images to be later used by
api.nova.Server - and prepare them prior to wrapping entities fetched
with novaclient with api.nova.Server. Thus the number of calls to
Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the image entity
within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Sutyagin <dsutyagin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Karikh <pkarikh@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9
'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2015-11-03 14:02:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/ff2cfaf0448730787af813964681686dd001c92f', 'message': "Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

The solution proposed in this change accomplishes this by caching
glance images as they are encountered in the call to 'image_get' in
'api.nova.Server', thus eliminating the need for an API call the next
time an instance with the same image is found. Thus the number of
calls to Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the
image entity within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

The usage of cache most likely will become obsolete when Glance will
be able to give back several images with one request, see
https://goo.gl/LWPKcK

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Sutyagin <dsutyagin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Karikh <pkarikh@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9
"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2015-11-03 14:30:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1b5209e503d8152e80f880fc8a320d14c29995ff', 'message': "Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

The solution proposed in this change accomplishes this by caching
glance images as they are encountered in the call to 'image_get' in
'api.nova.Server', thus eliminating the need for an API call the next
time an instance with the same image is found. Thus the number of
calls to Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the
image entity within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

The usage of cache most likely will become obsolete when Glance will
be able to give back several images with one request, see
https://goo.gl/LWPKcK

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Sutyagin <dsutyagin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Karikh <pkarikh@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9
"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2017-12-01 15:10:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6440fb4562a99113fc03aa85ec1bcf77665d5337', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

Server list triggers call to Glance for each server, even if server
is booted from same image. Such behavior is suboptimal and leads
to many unnecessary requests to Glance.

This patch uses glance list filtering, which allow to query images
for the list of required ids. See [1] for details.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/#show-images

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9

commit_message:
Call Glance list with certain image ids

This patch uses glance list filtering, which allow to query images
for the list of required ids. See [1] for details.

Patch rebased to master. Added test for proposed Glance API request

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/#show-images

Related-Bug: #1508554
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Co-Authored-By: Vadym Markov <markov.vadim@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove test for msgfmt import

The infra scripts test that msgfiles are correct and will not import
anything. Remove the test - especially since it fails when no
translations are available.

Change-Id: Iadca470d5e6e11dfcc3d7b72c6ad636d6f6dc5df
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Move charts off using the :latest built tags

This updates charts that consume images built from osh-images to
use tags other than the :latest tags. This will be followed up
with the definition of jobs to allow for vetting out of updated
images, as reliance on :latest tags assumes any change merged into
osh-images will result in functionally correct behavior (which has
shown to not be the case traditionally)

Change-Id: I181aa56ed187604dc7583d8081e53cc69eb27310
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add affiliations and country to structured data

The YAML output from the owners utility can be useful for
demographic analysis of OpenStack contributors as well as vetting
candidates for election. In some cases, candidate affiliation
matters explicitly, for example in the member affiliation diversity
requirement of the TC charter. Since OSF member profiles often
contain affiliation and country, incorporate them into the resulting
YAML detail.

Change-Id: I2e866ee21cbc20517f205726b91abeb361abfdbf

commit_message:
Track oldest and newest Gerrit change numbers

When including oldest and newest change merged dates for entries in
the structured data sets, also provide additional newest_id and
oldest_id fields with the corresponding Gerrit change numbers for
added verifiability.

Change-Id: Ia9c53fc5e8cc2af0cbbfafa5fba0408858f9bd4f

commit_message:
Include contributors to repos for SIGs in TC rolls

It's been the intent ever since the TC started keeping a record of
what Git repositories are controlled by official SIGs, that the
contributors to those repositories should be eligible to vote in TC
elections. Add that feature, along with a command-line option for
specifying a non-default file in the event the official one needs to
be overridden, and use the same zeroing logic as is used for
skipping the legacy file for retired repositories, for the same
reasons.

Change-Id: I65d2a620a0e4b81d0ef685a7fedb0e7800cbff9f

commit_message:
No longer match on repository short names

With the expansion of OpenDev's hosting, it is no longer guaranteed
that the last component of a repository's name is globally unique in
the OpenDev Gerrit deployment. Continuing to assume otherwise risks
incorrectly including the wrong projects in electoral roll
generation.

Change-Id: I1e96789d51dc53433b329cd13d4204301b2f07f3

commit_message:
Add a -v/--verbose option to owners utility

Similar to other command-line tools, give the owners utility a
verbose option supporting multiple verbosity levels, for added
debugging capability.

Change-Id: I839c8302db4a9ad887f175b5b0efc64fdc114ab9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/64/687164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument("-v", "--verbose", action="count", default=0, help="Increase program verbosity")

commit_message:
Use --containerized flag to support 1.{13,14,15}.x in Atomic

The flag has been removed in Kubernetes version 1.16.x for which users
should use Podman but to continue to use Fedora Atomic without
use_podman=true which means using Docker 1.13.x, ServiceAccount tokens
cannot be propagated without using the --containerized flag when
use_podman=false.

This flag should not have been removed in
I3efd4e55e885b95721f13279b44dc1246e2fd2e4.

Story: 2006846
Task: 37434

Change-Id: I5ccef63de928ff01d10dc4cc500d0e1583eb0378

commit_message:
Allow empty common_featureset

Fixed bug that prevented disabling common_featureset in child jobs.

Now we can give define a non-true value in order to disable it.

Change-Id: Ifdf2c580f42ca40ab6b20db6bb663d355f92b5c1

commit_message:
Drop python2 tests

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.
magnum is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html#completion-criteria

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/693631

Change-Id: I2ce19b3f976619853117231ae0dae24ebe68601f
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/21/691721/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: envlist = py27,py37,pep8basepython = python3 commands = oslo_debug_helper -t magnum/tests/unit {posargs} [testenv:debug-py27] basepython = python2.7basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

subject: docs: Rewrite host aggregate, availability zone docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-24 15:26:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7d83284cead048e24d7c503093d13c22993f1a6a', 'message': "WIP: docs: Rewrite host aggregate, availability zone docs

These closely related features are the source of a disproportionate
number of bugs and a large amount of confusion among users. The spread
of information around multiple docs probably doesn't help matters.

Do what we've already done for the metadata service and remote consoles
and clean these docs up. There are a number of important changes:

- All documentation related to host aggregates and availability zones is
  placed in one of three documents, '/user/availability-zones',
  '/admin/aggregates' and '/admin/availability-zones'. (note that there
  is no '/user/aggregates' document since this is not user-facing

- References to these features are updated to point to the new location

- A glossary is added. Currently this only contains definitions for host
  aggregates and availability zones

- Some gaps in related documentation are closed

The '--keep-going' flag is added to the 'sphinx-build' call in 'tox.ini'
since I found it useful while debugging things I'd broken in the
process.

Change-Id: If847b0085dbfb4c813d4a8d14d99346f8252bc19
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Rewrite host aggregate, availability zone docs

These closely related features are the source of a disproportionate
number of bugs and a large amount of confusion among users. The spread
of information around multiple docs probably doesn't help matters.

Do what we've already done for the metadata service and remote consoles
and clean these docs up. There are a number of important changes:

- All documentation related to host aggregates and availability zones is
  placed in one of three documents, '/user/availability-zones',
  '/admin/aggregates' and '/admin/availability-zones'. (note that there
  is no '/user/aggregates' document since this is not user-facing)

- References to these features are updated to point to the new location

- A glossary is added. Currently this only contains definitions for host
  aggregates and availability zones

- nova CLI commands are replaced with their openstack CLI counterparts

- Some gaps in related documentation are closed

Change-Id: If847b0085dbfb4c813d4a8d14d99346f8252bc19
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Splits STIG yum add/removes

In order to prevent RPM database corruption on the target hosts, this
change splits the STIG yum add/remove tasks into two separate plays.

Change-Id: I68751339d5b4cbfb61b8e3cf4ffbfeb47ea5fd76
Closes-Bug: #1851954
(cherry picked from commit 8db1a33cbf636865fd876f2e312972c0f1d28c04)

commit_message:
Set compute API microversion to 'latest' when calling Nova.

This is needed because the compute API microversion will
need to change to enable the Cyborg ARQ notification event.
(See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692707 .)

Change-Id: I6a1ee1a282d15441fcd9d27300c4f60d52c2b8a6

commit_message:
Remove references to writable LDAP from documentation

Keystone removed support for writable LDAP backends in Ocata. Prior to
that it was deprecated for several releases. This commit removes
references to those configuration options since they are silently
ignored. This cleans up the configuration files and doesn't give the
impression that functionality is still supported.

Relevant release notes that advertize the removal:

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/ocata.html#relnotes-11-0-0-origin-stable-ocata-other-notes

Change-Id: Id05247d004ee7d189dff3ec867a6ec11dfc40e9b
(cherry picked from commit 83dc547d675b550de13278dce66961c7d45759c6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/04/695404/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Grafana: Add support for arbitrary environment variables

This updates the Grafana chart to support the definition of
arbitrary environment variables to support scenarios where
additional information may be required at runtime for things like
datasource and dashboard provisioning

Change-Id: I95e4abe9030116a440c6d78a1d14dbcaaf743b40
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Delete instance_id_mappings record in instance_destroy

The instance_create DB API creates an instance_id_mappings record
but instance_destroy was not cleaning it up when the instance is
deleted; this adds that delete code. Otherwise those records
never get moved to shadow tables so you can't archive and purge them.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/684769

Change-Id: Idfe52d3c2f987b9aac551f013a0990423d87fad3
Closes-Bug: #1786298
(cherry picked from commit 8a6b57cf741e17d3de54ed8c85d9fb69c43e7432)
(cherry picked from commit 6186996c8093e723bdaa0e06664143685050312d)
(cherry picked from commit 1b6f48354b7eacecd7a146fc05a12537b4f22e18)

commit_message:
Adding missing tag for dynamic-address-fact task

Certain playbooks require dynamic facts at runtime and when
using tags like project-config, these tasks need to be called,
otherwise the template evaluation stops trying to resolve the facts.

Change-Id: I40e55671aed8df741e27ce8b2581b293a344afc0

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-12 12:46:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e3479a40fc4fe437c205e711493f43be81c6e46b', 'message': "Only nil az during shelve offload

I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502 introduced a change to nil out
the instance availability zone during shelve offload and when build or
unshelve fails. This fix works since queens as in queens the feature
introduced by XXX to use the original alternate hosts during re-schedule.
As in pike we don't have such feature during reschedule nova does a full
new scheduler run. However I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502
removed the availability zone information from the instance which causes
the re-schedule to select host from outside of the originally requested
availability zone during re-schedule.

This patch makes the az cleaning selective. If this is called from
shelve offload then the az of the instance is cleaned but when it called
in any other case the az is not cleaned to make sure that the
re-schedule keeps the originally requested az.

commit_message:
Only nil az during shelve offload

I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502 introduced a change to nil out
the instance availability zone during shelve offload and when build or
unshelve fails. This fix works from queens as in queens
Iae904afb6cb4fcea8bb27741d774ffbe986a5fb4 added the feature to use the
original alternate hosts during re-schedule.

As in pike we don't have such feature during reschedule nova does a full
new scheduler run. However I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502
removed the availability zone information from the instance which causes
the re-schedule to select host from outside of the originally requested
availability zone during re-schedule.

This patch makes the az cleaning selective and makes sure that the az is
not cleaned if re-schedule is triggered.

Change-Id: I5924de15e28873783ce7cf58d54e12b8786abead
Closes-Bug: #1852207

deleted_lines: # server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ERROR') # # bug 1852207: re-schedule allows to boot the server outside of the # requested availability zone so the instance ends up on the # compute_not_in_my_az host server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual('nova', server['OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone']) self.assertEqual( 'compute_not_in_my_az', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'])

commit_message:
Remove references to writable LDAP from documentation

Keystone removed support for writable LDAP backends in Ocata. Prior to
that it was deprecated for several releases. This commit removes
references to those configuration options since they are silently
ignored. This cleans up the configuration files and doesn't give the
impression that functionality is still supported.

Relevant release notes that advertize the removal:

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/ocata.html#relnotes-11-0-0-origin-stable-ocata-other-notes

Change-Id: Id05247d004ee7d189dff3ec867a6ec11dfc40e9b
(cherry picked from commit 83dc547d675b550de13278dce66961c7d45759c6)

commit_message:
[DNM] Ceph Nautilus compatibility

This change updates the Ceph charts to use Ceph Nautilus images
build on Ubuntu Bionic instead of Xenial. The mirror that hosts
Ceph packages only provides Nautilus packages for Bionic at
present, so this is necessary for Nautilus deployment.

There are also several configuration and scripting changes
included to provide compatibility with Ceph Nautilus. Most of
these simply allow existing logic to execute for Nautilus
deployments, but some logical changes are required to support
Nautilus as well.

Dependencies:
https://review.opendev.org/682767 - ceph-disk replaced with
ceph-volume
https://review.opendev.org/693577 - Bionic+Nautilus Docker images

Change-Id: If9d0f66b03b24cd1fde95071478b396ad2438bda

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] fix the osd container name with host overrides

This is to fix the logic to allign the container name in both the
cases where host overrides used and not used.

right now if we use host overrides then container name coming as
"ceph-osd-default" and in case if no host override then
"ceph-<<$daemonset>>-osd".

Change-Id: I3cdaa3a3fd3592f776fd549e6b77e32b564800b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/24/695424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Debian mod_wsgi python versions

Use horizon_venv_python_executable instead of the install_method to
decide what version of libapache2-mod-wsgi should be installed.

Change-Id: Ie68d587bf69af9d298a643b056edcbd6e2c8a73d

Set the default build to Bionic for Ceph images

This change modifies the Ceph image build scripts to build Bionic
images by default.

commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692120/
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1853000
Change-Id: I1afb5f2ef31ec61b3b224e5e1672fb9f12bcb110
(cherry picked from commit ad1ef91aa4158c96356b13291605d8f2044f3069)
(cherry picked from commit ca335af7cba23a8159cf0d875fb87f37549ced53)
(cherry picked from commit a429b0cf0b5065b925db26ed6558ff2128d0cbe3)

Now this value can be configurable by OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s).

commit_message:
Don't install syslinux-nonlinux on rhel7

the syslinux tools are in the syslinux package on
rhel7 and friends, but in rhel8 have moved to
syslinux-nonlinux

Change-Id: Iea74c2be6fbd738f35f178fa189384dd37579277

commit_message:
Disable journald-remote playbook

The journald-remote playbook is disabled by default until
https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/2376 has been
incorporated in current systemd packages.

Change-Id: Ie70729eaad095b52813610b94c6618c84b05c148
Closes-Bug: #1853198
(cherry picked from commit 1bd21d80e47a66be145911d6be80992dbe0cc7c2)

commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692119/
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1853000
Change-Id: I1afb5f2ef31ec61b3b224e5e1672fb9f12bcb110
(cherry picked from commit ad1ef91aa4158c96356b13291605d8f2044f3069)
(cherry picked from commit ca335af7cba23a8159cf0d875fb87f37549ced53)

Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692114/

commit_message:
Change horizon release model to cycle-with-intermediary

It was discussed in the Shanghai PTG.
horizon has two aspects: the one is to provide GUI to users and
the other is a library for horizon plugins.
When horizon plugins would like to use recent changes or to avoid bugs,
they need to consume beta releases of horizon.
More frequent releases of horizon would make more sense.
This commit changes the release model to cycle-with-intemediary.

After this change, horizon major version will be bumped when both
user-visible features and horizon plugin interfaces are dropped.
This menas the horizon major version can potentially be bumped
multiple times in a single development cycle.

Change-Id: I494063ca132b362cb769468fc588d71ec6264ca6

commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by dbs_timeout in
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle and by default is set to 60s.

Change-Id: Ib95c6b7614631eed264d42e6cf61672b705e7893
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1853000
(cherry picked from commit 15e21010a8a8594678afe385821ee804ec9e16c7)

added_lines: # [*dbs_timeout*] # (Optional) timeout for monitor of ovn dbs resource # Defaults to 60 # $dbs_timeout = hiera('tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle::dbs_timeout', 60), op_params => "start timeout=200s stop timeout=200s monitor interval=10s role=Master timeout=${dbs_timeout}s \ monitor interval=30s role=Slave timeout=${dbs_timeout}s",

commit_message:
Ignore blacklisted nodes when rendering network config

We don't include nodes blacklisted with 'DeploymentServerBlacklist'
in 'ServerIdData' stack output, that is used to populate
'server_roles' dict. Let's ignore writing NetworkConfig for those.

Change-Id: I837ed2dd7937a87055a8acff686ca3165dba3837
Closes-Bug: #1853247
(cherry picked from commit 750a47956376b7e790744e3392d784aa8cfc3f86)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Zun project is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ide32340821d015f6e02f33d2bdbf1ca238b3f68f

(you guessed it, it was a typo).

Add support for introspecting all_manageable nodes

This is a convienice option that is currently provided by the CLI
and now the playbook can handle it for us.

subject: Fixes issues with `rabbit_transport_url` method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-23 14:42:59.000000000', 'files': ['libraries/endpoints.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common/commit/eb203fe30b9f8f505245f9d73bb6f7e5aa78e1c5', 'message': 'Fixes issues with `rabbit_transport_url` method

When using rabbit_transport_url in a multi node environment, the address
used is the bind_address if we do not use a mq cluster, where it should
be the rabbit server endpoint hostname, if not we can end up with some
transport_url configurations as rabbit://<...>@0.0.0.0:<...>, if the
rabbit server is configured to listen on all interfaces.

Change-Id: If96ae42d836cbce43088efe483332cd2f7821457

commit_message:
Fixes issues with `rabbit_transport_url` method

When using rabbit_transport_url in a multi node environment, the address
used is the bind_address if we do not use a mq cluster, where it should
be the rabbit server endpoint hostname, if not we can end up with some
transport_url configurations as rabbit://<...>@0.0.0.0:<...>, if the
rabbit server is configured to listen on all interfaces.

Change-Id: If96ae42d836cbce43088efe483332cd2f7821457
Signed-off-by: Manuel Torrinha <manuel.torrinha@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>

'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid escapes in regular expression strings

The "r" for raw strings has to repeated when several strings are
concatenated, otherwise the backslash in the strings that miss
the "r" are interpreted directly, and result in invalid escapes.

Change-Id: I3736a40043c8aa6c36c21803bf68f842af5cd55e

commit_message:
RabbitMQ Exporter: Replace Direct Values w/ HTK

This change replaces direct references to the exporter port
in values.yaml with calls to helm-toolkit lookup functions.

The referenced port number under the network key is removed,
as the helm-toolkit function will return the port number under
the endpoints key.

Change-Id: Ib6f533c49af5a88fca377920d28d5468d7387892

commit_message:
Bump up ipa-ip-lookup-attempts to 6

To accommodate network setup that takes longer then
30 seconds increase the number of IP lookup attempts. This
allows for IPv6 setup that occurs after DHCP has time out.

Change-Id: I1351e150a63c6247210ca0cbc8ce0abfe82129cd

commit_message:
FC improve logging

This patch improves logging for the FC connector and simplifies a couple
of list and dict creations using generators.

The logging is around the modification that os-brick does of the
connection dictionary that Cinder sent.  It displays what the contents
were on entry and on exit, and it also warns if we are dropping some
targets because the Cinder driver returned inconsistent data.

Change-Id: I44bfd4939a850e8e080c4f8760244146a75f7218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/42/690642/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('Adding targets to connection properties receives: %s', connection_properties) targets = [(wwn, luns[0]) for wwn in wwns] wwpn_lun_map = {wwpn: lun for wwpn, lun in targets} # If there is an initiator_target_map we can update it too and generate # the initiator_target_lun_map from it itmaplun = dict() for init_wwpn, target_wwpns in itmap.items(): itmaplun[init_wwpn] = [(target_wwpn, wwpn_lun_map[target_wwpn]) for target_wwpn in target_wwpns if target_wwpn in wwpn_lun_map] # We added the if in the previous list comprehension in case # drivers return targets in the map that are not reported in # target_wwn or target_wwns, but we warn about it. if len(itmaplun[init_wwpn]) != len(itmap[init_wwpn]): unknown = set(itmap[init_wwpn]) unknown.difference_update(itmaplun[init_wwpn]) LOG.warning('Driver returned an unknown targets in the ' 'initiator mapping %s', ', '.join(unknown)) connection_properties['initiator_target_lun_map'] = itmaplun LOG.debug('Adding targets to connection properties returns: %s', connection_properties)
deleted_lines: targets = [] for wwn in wwns: targets.append((wwn, luns[0])) wwpn_lun_map = dict() for wwpn, lun in targets: wwpn_lun_map[wwpn] = lun # If there is an initiator_target_map we can update it too new_itmap = dict() for init_wwpn in itmap: target_wwpns = itmap[init_wwpn] init_targets = [] for target_wwpn in target_wwpns: if target_wwpn in wwpn_lun_map: init_targets.append((target_wwpn, wwpn_lun_map[target_wwpn])) new_itmap[init_wwpn] = init_targets connection_properties['initiator_target_lun_map'] = new_itmap

commit_message:
Kafka: Add support for defining settings via overrides

This change updates the entrypoint for Kafka to read settings
defined in values.yaml, exporting them to the environment, before
proceeding with the startup script provided by the image authors.

This process allows us to override default values for kafka's
server.properties and log4j.properties files as needed.

See start-kafka.sh for implementation details here:
https://github.com/wurstmeister/kafka-docker/blob/master/start-kafka.sh

Change-Id: I08b055be2f898d48aff30c78c6a01e1ef2f8a05b

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Senlin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: I0377788d0db0e60d44c35f1d26eefd58502a452a

subject: Support etcd v3.3.11 with authentication enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-12 11:50:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico/commit/9872dca22f4a68e48fe6b245fd680ffdecf31048', 'message': "Add etcd auth token support

As of etcd v3.3.11, installations using etcd user authentication must
arrange for their grpc-gateway clients (which is what the Calico DHCP
agent and Neutron driver are) to provide an Authorization token on
each HTTP request.  This change enables that:

- the installer can configure an auth token for the Calico components
  to use, in 'etcd_auth_token' in neutron.conf

- the code changes here ensure that that token is included on each
  HTTP request.

Change-Id: Iac16beeedd3006b1e7cf3ee49cf2247e692ba434
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-11-15 11:29:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico/commit/a2b65ff8bd8369674d46f0c7f41e1ca3f21f7f1b', 'message': 'Support etcd v3.3.11 with authentication enabled

As of etcd v3.3.11, installations using etcd user authentication must
arrange for their grpc-gateway clients (which is what the Calico DHCP
agent and Neutron driver are) to provide an Authorization token on
each HTTP request.  This change enables that:

- the installer can configure an auth username and password for the
  Calico components to use, in neutron.conf

- the code changes here use that config to obtain a token and ensure

commit_message:
Support etcd v3.3.11 with authentication enabled

As of etcd v3.3.11, installations using etcd user authentication must
arrange for their grpc-gateway clients (which is what the Calico DHCP
agent and Neutron driver are) to provide an Authorization token on
each HTTP request.  This change enables that:

- the installer can configure an auth username and password for the
  Calico components to use, in neutron.conf

- the code changes here use that config to obtain a token and ensure
  that that token is included on each HTTP request.

Change-Id: Iac16beeedd3006b1e7cf3ee49cf2247e692ba434

commit_message:
Add ceph metrics to postrun metrics gathering role

This updates the gather-prom-metrics role to include gathering
metrics from the active ceph-mgr endpoint

Change-Id: Icb5d27b6a070e9065f6276725bf06dec7d2cbc0d
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
CI: Add mariadb test

Tests the following operations for MariaDB:

* Stop
* Recovery

Backup and restore will be added in a separate change.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/693329
Change-Id: I836d91554715cce0e82c1bbebb7430c457418b2d

commit_message:
CI: Add more service list checks to OS "smoke testing"

Change-Id: Ie7ee70e19536c2d8f4300df55c9c6ca38abb7ae4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/17/694517/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack --debug orchestration service list if [[ $ACTION =~ "ceph" ]] || [[ $ACTION == "cinder-lvm" ]]; then openstack --debug volume service list fi
